# LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic

**Enumeration**

Designates the intended usage of a vertex attribute.

## Declaration

```swift
enum VertexSemantic
```

## Overview

RealityKit consults the vertex semantic when interpreting the data in your [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/LowLevelMesh]. For example, an attribute with the semantic value of [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/LowLevelMesh/VertexSemantic/position] determines the position of a vertex.

## Specifying intended use

- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.bitangent**: The semantic for surface bitangent vector data.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.color**: The semantic for per-vertex color data.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.normal**: The semantic for surface normal data.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.position**: The semantic for vertex position data.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.tangent**: The semantic for surface tangent vector data.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.unspecified**: The semantic that doesn’t specify the role of the vertex.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv0**: The semantic for the first UV channel, also known as UV0.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv1**: The semantic for the second UV channel, also known as UV1.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv2**: The semantic for the third UV channel, also known as UV2.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv3**: The semantic for the fourth UV channel, also known as UV3.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv4**: The semantic for the fifth UV channel, also known as UV4.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv5**: The semantic for the sixth UV channel, also known as UV5.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv6**: The semantic for the seventh UV channel, also known as UV6.
- **LowLevelMesh.VertexSemantic.uv7**: The semantic for the eighth UV channel, also known as UV7.

## Updatable meshes

- **Integrating virtual objects with your environment**: Create an immersive game using native anchor support, environmental blending, model manipulation, and mesh instance duplication.
- **Creating a spatial drawing app with RealityKit**: Use low-level mesh and texture APIs to achieve fast updates to a person’s brush strokes by integrating RealityKit with ARKit and SwiftUI.
- **Creating a plane with low-level mesh**: Create a low-level mesh and set its vertex positions and normals to form a plane.
- **LowLevelMesh**: A container for vertex data that you can use to create and update meshes using your own format.
- **LowLevelMesh.Descriptor**: An object that describes the data format and layout of the buffers in a low-level mesh.
- **LowLevelMesh.Part**: An object that describes a range of primitives to display, and their material index.
- **LowLevelMesh.Layout**: An object that describes a set of attributes that share a buffer index, offset, and stride.
- **LowLevelMesh.Attribute**: An object that determines how to store vertex attribute data in memory and map it to RealityKit shader attributes.
- **LowLevelMesh.PartsCollection**: An object that holds a mutable collection low-level mesh parts.
- **LowLevelBuffer**
- **LowLevelInstanceData**

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
